Really nice dinner. Lots of sharing of excellent food. Flavours galore. The staff was also amazing considering a good allergy -- showed us what was safe, as well as what could be made without. Super accommodating, and the meal was just terrific.

Great offer on Sundays. 3 tapas & dessert for ¬£22.95. It was delicious. Menu is separated into sections so vegetarian options are easily identified. We had 6 and out of a possible 12 (?). Amazing. All delicious. Special mention to the goats cheese! And the desserts were great too. We chose brownie and cheesecake. Staff were lovely.  Keeping an eye on everybody. It was very busy but the wait for food and a very nice glass of rose was minimal.

First time here and not the last. The host was great as we were half an hour early but got seated even though it was really busy. The service was top class with every member of staff working really well together. The food was excellent so will have to go back and try some different dishes. Really nice atmosphere though the chatting was a little loud at times which can't be helped. My recommendation is the gambas picantes.

I loved this place so much, went there twice during my short stay in Glasgow.
The raspberry dessert I had was probably the best dessert I‚Äôve had in a while.
The next time I visited, I had their weekend Spanish Brunch, it was amazing.
Would highly recommend this place.

Food is very good, we had a great selection of tapas and it was really tasty.
Service was quick, and the plates were really hot, which is a good trait.
It was a midweek day, and the place was still buzzing, so that was a good sign.
If you like Spanish food, I can recommend this place, and it's not extortionate in its pricing.

Absolutely loved this place! Visited 3 times in 2 days. Staff were super lovely and the menu was fab.
I was the only vegan in our group of 3 and was impressed with the available options, it was hard to choose. Both breakfasts I had The All American pancakes, super fluffy pancakes with mixed berries, granola and maple.... So good!
Friends had french toast, granola bowl and smoothies and love it all.
Coffee was delicious and the added bonus of the music was good on all 3 visits.
Can't recommend this place enough.
I'll definitely go back next time I'm in Glasgow.

Delightful eating experience. Me and my daughter were in today. Lovely young woman said there was a ten minute wait but then found us a seat immediately. Delicious food at a very good price. Everyone smiling and welcoming. Highly recommended! (Keith and Amelia).

It's the best place for the yummy food and also healthy food I would say.
The staff are very friendly. I love the ambience.
Definitely worth going to. I highly recommend this place if you are looking to have a balanced diet food.

Amazing place to eat a breakfast!
We ordered Heatlhy Start and Flower Power smoothie. Very delicious and I did it feel hunger after eating at all.
Also the interior design is pretty cool!
Food was stunning as always. Big smile and hello when I walked. In Lucy was great, super friendly.

Place is really cute. Doesn‚Äôt have parking which made it a little difficult to access as we had to find parking then walk there. But it‚Äôs a nice walk! The wait staff attention to detail could be better. Had to remind twice for water, I asked what a couple things on the menu were and they weren‚Äôt sure. I was given no cutlery when I got my meal which I had to ask for. The atmosphere was lovely. And the food ok. I made the wrong choice! The Dog menu is a cute touch!

Some of the best food nice have eaten for a long time.. Great staff.  Nice location, by the canal. Parking is tricky but we got a space. The crispy kale was amazing. Steak sandwich was outstanding.  And my hot smoked salmon, avocado on sour dough toast with poached eggs. Was also outstanding.  Free water to the table. Coffee was first class so was the pot of tea. Booking recommended.

Finally visited Ocho as it's been on my list to visit since moving to Glasgow years ago. It is a cute small place. Stunning views of Glasgow and a nice canal walk just at the front. Not the easiest place to get to but worth a visit

THE WHOLE PACKAGE!
Ocho has it all for me - well presented tasty food at a reasonable price, genuinely lovely, engaging staff....and an incredibly scenic location.
I love it and recommend it.

Food is good but the service and staff is excellent.

London Fog (earl grey with milk froth) was tasty.

Make sure it‚Äôs not a date if you‚Äôre going for the Turkish Eggs. Decent garlic!

Build your brunch is the best!

Definitely would go back for more.

Omg - this was so good. The mango & peach pie is so much better than McD equivalents.
Chicken was nice and juicy. Spicy chicken was nice and properly spicy.
Only negatives was that 2 deliveroo drivers dropped but was still warm when arrived and they forgot/don't offer cutlery which would have been useful with the loaded fries.

The Spicy Chicken Burger and Peach Mango pie was great, The chicken was tender.

However the loaded fries were a massive let down as was the gravy. The cheese was not melted (Likely because the fries were not hot enough)
The Gravy tastes like instant gravy you can find at a supermarket.
Nice junk food if you like to try one day but high price I think compared to other fast food. I hope they take care about cleaning after customers because it is disgusting.

Came here too try chicken burger. It was good. & there chicken tenders were good too. Gravy was nice flavour. The chicken I got with burger on the side was too crunchy
And very dry. Would return for there burgers and chicken tenders
Returned 28th September. Dirty tables not cleaned for over 30mins while I ate my food

Excellent fast food chain in Glasgow city. The staff and Jollibee training programme definitely deserve credits here.

They were always smiling and well mannered, hardworking to clean up regularly. So the place looks tidy and welcoming with spacious seating.

Food quality is good with lots of choices. Fair value for money. Overall much much better than other fast food giants üëçüèøüëèüèø

Nice Saturday afternoon for lunch and catch up with family. I would advise booking as was very busy. Great extensive menu, lovely atmosphere inside, our waitress was lovely, friendly and efficient. Now to the food :) I had the stuffed pepper that was lovely although I felt could have been cooked that wee bit longer. The pasta was similar nice although felt it could also have been cooked a little bit longer. I would go back and try something different.  Reasonable priced and coffee (flat white) was OK if a little strong

Food was great, staff friendly and helpful. We didn't like where our table was sitting which was right next to the stairs leading to toilets. On a busy Saturday afternoon this meant there was a constant stream of people squeezing passed each other next to us while we were being served and eating, staff were also squeezing passed moving tables and chairs. Our table was not nearly big enough for our dishes. Enjoyable but not very relaxing.

They offer a great tasting menu where you can order three small dishes. I ordered the pizza, spicy potato bites and garlic bread and it was all great, really nice flavours and good value for money. Will definitely be back to sample their other dishes.

Went here just after Christmas. Booked online and was given a table upstairs.  The restaurant was really busy, we opted for the Christmas menu. I had the pate which arrived looking whipped, almost like chocolate frosting. There was so much, I didn't enjoy it.  For the main I really like the pasta Penne Mia Casa, was so nice. Its Penne pasta with chicken, broccoli and chilli. I had enough and didn't have dessert but still had to pay for all 3 courses.  My friend enjoyed her 3 courses, we had some cocktails they were not bad.  Would go back and think maybe when else busy would be have a better experience.

Had a meal here on Friday night with my partner and had a great experience.

The decor is beautiful, inside and out, the whole place is very clean and well laid out and the staff were very attentive and friendly.

We had one of their sharing dishes plus a few sides (Carbonara, parmesan fries, garlic bread and 5" pizza) and everything was delicious and extremely reasonably priced compared with other similar establishments in the area. We had a few cocktails as well and these were also very well made and delicious.

Perfect venue for date night or group celebrations.

Would definitely recommend and will certainly be back in the future

This was a gift from my daughter,it was Friday 29th Dec and the atmosphere was superb.We were seated upstairs and it was very cosy and exceptionally hot,Waiting Staff were quick to serve and friendly,cocktails  were delicious and the food was piping hot and plentiful the deserts were huge and rounded off our meal,it was very reasonably priced   10/10
Service was excellent and the chef came out to enquire about our meals. Thd mussels as a starter were my highlight. Would definitely go back.
Lovely food and friendly service. Bargain lunch menu.

We came in on the off chance of grabbing a table.  The man at the front of house said we could but he needed it back ASAP and we needed to be quick.  The service was then really slow, the starters were quick to come out but the mains took a good half hour at least to come out.

The food was okay but nothing to really shout about but it was decent value for many as we got 2 courses for ¬£20 on the pre theatre menu.

Staff were nice, starters were good, the lasagne was watery, however, they have started adding a service charge, for a table of 10 I get it, but for a table of 2? Come on, I left the exact money and didn't tip. As I'll do with anywhere putting a service charge on.

The food is really nice, but the waiter and owner of the restaurant were way too chatty, asking invasive personal questions, even though I clearly showed that I don't want to engage with them in a conversation and it happened to me several times already. Probably not visiting ever again.
